data.title: Waffle and chicken are great
data.text: Go to this place after the children museum with the kids. Technically a sports bar but the usually quiet when I go. The kids meals good portions and comes includes a kids sized ice cream at end.

data.title: Skip it
data.text: Great friendly service,  nice to eat outdoors but the food is poor and homeless people are watching you eat

data.title: Great bar and food
data.text: It's a bar with a restaurant.  Not a restaurant with a bar.  FYI.  Lots of TV's.  Been a few times.  Ordered the fried pork chop tonight.  Wasn't expecting much but it was wonderful.  Great mashed potatoes and collards too.  Service was great.  It's not for everyone but if you don't mind a bar atmosphere with some comfort food try it out.

data.title: Weekend in town
data.text: After arriving in town we were looking for a local restaurant.  It was full energetic and lively.  We had a great waitress and the food was pretty good for bar food.  It was a fun atmosphere and would go back again if in town again.

data.title: Great location
data.text: Great selection of food and an amazing location with service that will make you feel at home. Love the area and the food

data.title: Dinner out
data.text: Food was fine.  Seafood wasn't local.  All in all average. Table wasn't clean.  Beer selection is pretty good.

data.title: Delicious lunch
data.text: We stopped here after checking out the local antique shops and had a delicious lunch. The menu gave us  a lot to choose from and the service was top notch. One of the local antique store owners had recommended this place for us to try. We will stop here again when in the area again.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: The food was fantastic.  Servings were huge. Had the crab soup. Was full of crab meat and had great flavor.  Would recommend it as an appetizer. I had the burrito which was about 8 inches by 4 inches. Was very good, not to spicey and not under spiced. The chips are crisp and cooked to perfection.  Would definitely return for another great meal. I do have to ding the service. There was maybe 30 people in the restaurant and it seemed to take for ever to get are food.

data.title: Dinner and the game
data.text:
The bar was recommended so we could watch the Huskers game while in Portsmouth. They switched one of the big TVs for us, which was great.
The Food was OK, while the place itself seemed a little worn out...a good updating would put the shine back on this nice sized sports bar with a great central location. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Horrible Service and the food wasn't much better
data.text: Worse service I think I've ever had. Seated at our table at 5:30 and at 7:00 half of our party of 8 hadn't gotten our food yet. Second round of drinks took 40 minutes and for those that did get their food, got their appetizers about 5 minutes after we received our main course. We spoke to the manager or head waitress or whoever she was who gave a half hearted apology but the waitress never said a thing acting like it was no big deal. No discount or anything and to top it off those of us that paid cash and were due change, only got paper money back as the waitress evidently tipped herself the coin change.  Been there a few times but that was the last and I know the owner could care less

data.title: Across from kids museum; just "eh"
data.text: From VB and this was our first time this side of the water with our kids (6yo and 9mo). This place is huge, lots of neat seating areas outside and in, quiet during lunch. Food *looked* good, but was overall bland. I did ask for my burger to be well done, but hubby said it looked more like a hockey puck. Didn't taste like much, even with the BBQ sauce, cheese, and onion straws. Hubby's chicken was over fried. Service was hit and miss. If we visit the kids museum again we will find somewhere else to eat. Eh.

data.title: Avoid
data.text: I will not be visiting this place again, avoid at all cost. The service we received was terrible it took forever for the waitress to come. Had an issue and had to wait 45 min for a manager. Once again avoid at all cost.

data.title: Great  food and Cold Beers
data.text: We went there for dinner. We started with apps, chicken livers, shrimp, chicken wings, then the entree of brisket, mashed potato and peas. The brisket was slow cooked +ten hours so you could cut it with your fork. The food was great but the service was par. It took a long time to get drinks. We would have stayed a little while longer, but  as soon as dinner was cleared the checks came.

data.title: Good food and service
data.text:
This was the first time I had ever been here.  It is a favorite of locals and has a good menu.  I got the chicken and waffles and my friend for the broiled crab cake sandwich and they were both good.  We had a party of 8 and our waitress was very attentive. 

There are multiple screens for news and sports.  Sometimes, they have live bands.  It is in the Old Towne section of Portsmouth, VA.  It is a historical part of the country dating back to the 1600s.  Take some time to walk around the area, but I do not suggest you go anywhere else in Portsmouth.  It is not a safe city.

The only reason I did not give it five stars is because the restrooms could have been cleaner.

data.title: Good for big groups
data.text: We went  for dinner a team dinner with a party of 40! Glad I called to adjust our reservation since they had no record of it. They accommodated us in a back section with large screen TVs which was nice. This was one of the few places we found who could handle such a large group. Food was good and reasonably priced. Service was good and friendly and accurately kept track of multiple checks.

data.title: Come hungry....leave happy.
data.text: Our host at the B & B suggested Roger Brown's and she was spot on.  Crab cakes were outstanding , bbq was exceptional, beer and wine selection very good and if you're lucky enough to get Bridget to serve you your dining experience will perfect.  But be hungry or there will be take home in your future!

data.title: Great Dinner
data.text: We really enjoyed our dinner here. The menu selection was great. The food was great. But...our service stood out the most! We had an excellent server! He was am older gentleman and i wish i could remember his name. He knew everything about the menu, made great recommendations, and told great stories!!

data.title: Great beer and crabcakes
data.text: Been to Roger Brown's several times. Almost always our "Go-to" when in Portsmouth for a concert. This really has to be one of the best Sports Bars in America! A huge bar with many TVs, an expansive beer selection and friendly staff. Really cool sports memorabilia throughout, of course featuring Mr. Brown's career, but a lot of local flavor. My crabcake sandwich was tremendous, with no filler and served up with crispy fries. My wife's flounder sandwich was HUGE. I told her I would've liked to have caught that one! All-in-all, great food, great service, great location. What more would you want?

data.title: Three Nights in a Row
data.text: I must have liked the place since I went there 3 nights in a row. Basically your sports bar atmosphere. Close to the waterfront. Quite a large place with plenty of TVs. Food was decent. Beers were cold. Kept going back so I must have liked it. Nice Happy hour from 5-7.

data.title: Service needs a kick start!!
data.text:
The food was actually decent but the service was absolutely horrible.   We waited to be seated for quite some time while 3 bartenders stood chatting, looking at us and chose to ignore that we weren't being helped.   Waitress didn't seem interested in anything about her job except socializing.   It took us forever to eat our meal.   Can't say we'd be back.   But if your in the area, it's likely the best place on High St compared to some of the other places we saw.   Longboards was advertising Hawaiin food and had Hawaiin prices to boot!   Sorry Longboards, but it's Va by a bay, not a secluded island!   

I will say that as the day got later the people going there in droves seemed like what you'd see in a gangster video!   I'll leave it at that!
